DataElement.preferredName: Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma Variation Histologic Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates the type of squamous cell carcinoma variant.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma Variation Histologic Type
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma originating in the lung. Lung carcinomas usually arise from the epithelium that lines the bronchial tree (bronchogenic carcinomas), and are classified as small cell or non-small cell carcinomas. Non-small cell lung carcinomas are usually adenocarcinomas, squamous cell carcinomas, or large cell carcinomas. Metastatic carcinomas to the lung are also common, and can be difficult to distinguish from primary tumors._A carcinoma arising from squamous epithelial cells.  Morphologically, it is characterized by the proliferation of atypical, often pleomorphic squamous cells.  Squamous cell carcinomas are graded by the degree of cellular differentiation as well, moderately, or poorly differentiated.  Well differentiated carcinomas are usually associated with keratin production and the presence of intercellular bridges between adjacent cells.  Representative examples are lung squamous cell carcinoma, skin squamous cell carcinoma, and cervical squamous cell carcinoma._An alteration or difference from a norm or standard._Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma originating in the lung.  Lung carcinomas usually arise from the epithelium that lines the bronchial tree (bronchogenic carcinomas), and are classified as small cell or non-small cell carcinomas.  Non-small cell lung carcinomas are usually adenocarcinomas, squamous cell carcinomas, or large cell carcinomas.  Metastatic carcinomas to the lung are also common, and can be difficult to distinguish from primary tumors. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma originating in the lung. Lung carcinomas usually arise from the epithelium that lines the bronchial tree (bronchogenic carcinomas), and are classified as small cell or non-small cell carcinomas. Non-small cell lung carcinomas are usually adenocarcinomas, squamous cell carcinomas, or large cell carcinomas. Metastatic carcinomas to the lung are also common, and can be difficult to distinguish from primary tumors.

Property.preferredName: Squamous Cell Carcinoma Variation Histologic Type
Property.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from squamous epithelial cells.  Morphologically, it is characterized by the proliferation of atypical, often pleomorphic squamous cells.  Squamous cell carcinomas are graded by the degree of cellular differentiation as well, moderately, or poorly differentiated.  Well differentiated carcinomas are usually associated with keratin production and the presence of intercellular bridges between adjacent cells.  Representative examples are lung squamous cell carcinoma, skin squamous cell carcinoma, and cervical squamous cell carcinoma.:An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.:Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from squamous epithelial cells.  Morphologically, it is characterized by the proliferation of atypical, often pleomorphic squamous cells.  Squamous cell carcinomas are graded by the degree of cellular differentiation as well, moderately, or poorly differentiated.  Well differentiated carcinomas are usually associated with keratin production and the presence of intercellular bridges between adjacent cells.  Representative examples are lung squamous cell carcinoma, skin squamous cell carcinoma, and cervical squamous cell carcinoma.
An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.
Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Squamous Cell Carcinoma Variant Histologic Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.value: Basaloid variant of Squamous cell carcinoma 8083/3
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Squamous Cell Lung Carcinoma, Basaloid Variant

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Squamous Cell Lung Carcinoma, Basaloid Variant
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic variant of squamous cell lung carcinoma characterized by nuclear palisading. (NCI05)

Concepts.definition: A morphologic variant of squamous cell lung carcinoma characterized by nuclear palisading.

PermissibleValues.value: Small cell variant of Squamous cell carcinoma 8073/3
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Squamous Cell Lung Carcinoma, Small Cell Variant

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Squamous Cell Lung Carcinoma, Small Cell Variant
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A poorly differentiated morphologic variant of squamous cell lung carcinoma characterized by the presence of small tumor cells with focal squamous differentiation. (NCI05)

Concepts.longName: Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma, Small Cell Variant
Concepts.definition: A poorly differentiated morphologic variant of squamous cell lung carcinoma characterized by the presence of small tumor cells with focal squamous differentiation.

PermissibleValues.value: Clear cell variant of Squamous cell carcinoma 8084/3
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Squamous Cell Lung Carcinoma, Clear Cell Variant

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Squamous Cell Lung Carcinoma, Clear Cell Variant
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic variant of squamous cell lung carcinoma characterized by the presence of clear cells. (NCI05)

Concepts.longName: Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma, Clear Cell Variant
Concepts.definition: A morphologic variant of squamous cell lung carcinoma characterized by the presence of clear cells.

PermissibleValues.value: Papillary variant of Squamous cell carcinoma 8052/3
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Squamous Cell Lung Carcinoma, Papillary Variant

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Squamous Cell Lung Carcinoma, Papillary Variant
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic variant of squamous cell lung carcinoma characterized by the presence of papillary structures. (NCI05)

Concepts.longName: Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma, Papillary Variant
Concepts.definition: A morphologic variant of squamous cell lung carcinoma characterized by the presence of papillary structures.
